snippet: The operator of the Crandall Canyon coal mine, where a 2007 collapse led to nine deaths, agreed on Friday to plead guilty to two misdemeanor criminal charges and pay a $500,000 fine.
abstract: Genwal Resources Inc, the operator of the Crandall Canyon coal mine, where a 2007 collapse led to nine deaths, agrees to plead guilty to two misdemeanor criminal charges of violating health and safety standards and pay a $500,000 fine; Genwal is an affiliate of the Murray Energy Corporation.
lead_paragraph: The operator of the Crandall Canyon coal mine, where a 2007 collapse led to nine deaths, agreed on Friday to plead guilty to two misdemeanor criminal charges and pay a $500,000 fine.

headline.main: Utah: Guilty Plea in Mine Collapse
headline.print_headline: Utah: Guilty Plea In Mine Collapse
